intro: Ivesia lycopodioides var. megalopetala, commonly known as the large-petaled ivy-leafed plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrowly elliptic, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the genus Ivesia. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
